meanings.sent1: She enjoys expounding her ideas during class discussions.
meanings.sent2: He is expounding on the benefits of reading books to the children.
meanings.sent3: The cat was expounding on the importance of napping all day.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden were expounding their beauty to all who passed by.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's expounding of the lesson made it easy to understand.

meanings.definition: Setting forth or stating in detail
meanings.sent1: The professor is expounding the theory of relativity to his students.
meanings.sent2: They are expounding their plans for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was expounding on the best spots to find nuts in the park.
meanings.sent4: The waves were expounding their power as they crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent5: Her expounding of the rules clarified any confusion among the team members.
